Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Transcranial MRI-Guided Focused Ultrasound Surgery for Glioblastoma

Trial_Design.evidence: In a randomised controlled trial, three glioblastoma patients were enrolled

Participants.evidence: three glioblastoma patients were enrolled based on specific eligibility criteria at a single clinical center

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to receive multiple focused ultrasound exposures using a hemispherical phased array transducer with patient-specific treatment planning

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the ability to achieve controlled and precise thermal ablation in the brain

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the intervention

Result_Outcome.evidence: The study demonstrated the feasibility of focusing an ultrasound beam transcranially into the brain and visualizing the heating with MR temperature imaging
